events.title: Treaty of Ghent Signed
events.description: The Treaty of Ghent was signed, ending the War of 1812 between the United States and Great Britain.
events.significance: This treaty restored relations between the two nations and ended years of conflict, shaping future US-UK diplomacy.

events.title: Christmas Truce of World War I
events.description: On Christmas Eve, an unofficial ceasefire occurred along the Western Front where opposing soldiers fraternized and exchanged gifts.
events.significance: This event highlighted the shared humanity amidst conflict and remains a powerful symbol of peace during wartime.

events.title: Apollo 8 Enters Lunar Orbit
events.description: Apollo 8 became the first manned spacecraft to orbit the Moon, with astronauts broadcasting live images back to Earth.
events.significance: This milestone paved the way for the Apollo 11 Moon landing and marked a significant achievement in human space exploration.

events.title: The Sandinistas Take Control of Nicaragua
events.description: The Sandinista National Liberation Front overthrew the Somoza dictatorship and took control of Nicaragua.
events.significance: This revolution led to major political and social changes in Nicaragua, influencing Cold War geopolitics in Central America.
